text:
Shane Keith Warne (born 13 September 1969) is an Australian cricket commentator and former player. He captained the Australian national team in One Day Internationals (ODI). He is often called one of the greatest bowlers in the history of the game. He retired from international cricket in January 2007, at the end of Australia's 5–0 Ashes series victory over England.
Warne was born in Upper Ferntree Gully, Victoria. He has three children with his ex-wife Simone Callahan. He has complete heterochromia, from which one of his eyes is blue, and the other green.
